repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Library

did.unittitle: Hampton Antiquarian and Historical Society Collection
did.abstract: This collection contains the archive of the Hampton Antiquarian and Historical Society. Built on a diverse collection of documents, photographs and artifacts, the collection showcases the history of Hampton from the nineteenth century through early twentieth century.

altformavail.head: Location of Copies or Alternate Formats
altformavail.p: Digital reproductions of materials in this collection may also be found in the Archives & Special Collections digital repository.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by broad category determined by format or subject.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Founded in 1968, the Hampton Antiquarian and Historical Society is located at the Burnham-Hibbard House. In 1984, Archives & Special Collections received the Hampton Antiquarian and Historical Society's collections on deposit.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: With the exception of the records of the Hampton Antiquarian & Historical Society (Series IV), the materials in the collection were donated over time to the HA&HS located in Hampton, CT, as part of the organization's ongoing mission to document the history of Hampton and its environs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This broad collection dates from the early nineteenth to the early twentieth century. Featuring Administrative records, awards, books, clippings, correspondence, ephemera, financial records, interviews, legal documents, manuscripts, military records, oral histories, photographs, postcards, posters, publications, realia, and scrapbooks, the collection offers a wide range of sources relevant to the history of Hampton.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated materials
separatedmaterial.p: The following titles associated with this collection have been cataloged: Hampton Gazette Dodd Periodicals Plan of Development Dodd C 11630

did.unittitle: Series I: Account books, Day books and Ledgers
Bills and receipts, George Tiffany & Son, Allen Jewett,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: [Volume has little content aside from a brief genealogy of Mr. Darrow, a tin peddlar.]

did.unittitle: G. & H. Brown, Agent, [Collinsville, CT] Day book,
Index [possibly part of William Clark Day book]
Kimball Kennedy and Co. Day book,
Dorons, Henry L., State of Connecticut sympathy certificate,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: These files document the legal electors in the Town of Hampton as well as election rolls, 1844, 1874-1905.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains receipts and invoices for services and goods provided to the Town of Hampton from 1804 through 1925. The materials document in detail the individuals and local businesses that provided services (snow removal, school children transportation, sign creation, labor on state highway, support of paupers and mentally ill) as well as debts incurred by the Town and interaction with the State of Connecticut financial offices. Taken together the materials in this subseries present a detail view of a small, New England town from the late 19th century into the early 20th century.
